introduction.title: Introduction
introduction.description: EasyCard API allows you to integrate card management and payment functionality into your applications.

step1.title: Get your API Key
step1.description: Sign up for an EasyCard account and generate your API key from the dashboard.

step2.title: Make your first request
step2.description: Use your API key to authenticate and make requests to our endpoints.

step3.title: Go live
step3.description: Switch from test mode to production and start processing real transactions.

authentication.title: Authentication
authentication.description: All API requests require authentication using Bearer token in the Authorization header.

errorHandling.title: Error Handling
errorHandling.description: The API uses conventional HTTP response codes to indicate the success or failure of requests.

rateLimits.title: Rate Limits
rateLimits.description: API requests are limited to prevent abuse and ensure fair usage.

otp-send.title: Send OTP
otp-send.description: Send a one-time password to the user's phone number via SMS or WhatsApp for verification.

notes.0: Default OTP type is "whatsapp" if not specified
notes.1: For Kyrgyzstan (+996) numbers, SMS is used by default

otp-verify.title: Verify OTP
otp-verify.description: Verify the OTP code sent to the user's phone. Returns authentication token on success.

notes.0: For existing users, token is returned immediately
notes.1: For new users, is_new_user will be true and token may be null until profile is initialized

register-auth.title: Register / Check Phone
register-auth.description: Check if a phone number is registered and initiate the registration process if not.

verify-code.title: Verify SMS Code
verify-code.description: Verify the SMS code sent during registration.

resend-code.title: Resend Code
resend-code.description: Resend verification code to the user's phone number.

login.title: Login with Password
login.description: Authenticate user with phone number and password.

logout.title: Logout
logout.description: Invalidate the current authentication token and end the session.

set-password.title: Set Password
set-password.description: Set password for a new user after registration.

change-password.title: Change Password
change-password.description: Change password for an authenticated user.

forgot-password.title: Forgot Password
forgot-password.description: Request a password reset code to be sent via SMS, WhatsApp, or email.

notes.0: Email method is only available if user has email configured
notes.1: Default method is WhatsApp, except for +996 (Kyrgyzstan) which uses SMS

forgot-password-email.title: Forgot Password (Email)
forgot-password-email.description: Request a password reset code to be sent to the user's registered email.

get-current-user.title: Get Current User
get-current-user.description: Retrieve the profile of the currently authenticated user.

init-profile.title: Initialize / Update Profile
init-profile.description: Initialize profile for new users or update existing profile data.

notes.0: This endpoint is used both for initial profile setup and subsequent updates
notes.1: Mandatory fields: full_name, username, email, date_of_birth, gender
notes.2: Username must be unique across all users

get-user-email.title: Get User Email
get-user-email.description: Retrieve the email address associated with the current user.

deactivate-profile.title: Deactivate Profile
deactivate-profile.description: Deactivate the user profile. This is NOT for device logout - it deactivates the entire account.

notes.0: WARNING: This deactivates the entire user account, not just a device session
notes.1: Account can be reactivated by logging in again
notes.2: All active sessions will be terminated

upload-avatar.title: Upload Avatar Image
upload-avatar.description: Upload an avatar image for user profile. Returns file data with multiple size variants.

notes.2: Images are automatically resized to large, medium, and small variants
notes.3: Use the returned "id" in the init_profile endpoint to set as avatar

get-social-networks.title: Get Social Networks
get-social-networks.description: Retrieve social network links for a specific user.

set-social-networks.title: Set Social Networks
set-social-networks.description: Set or replace all social network links for the current user.

notes.0: This endpoint replaces all existing social networks
notes.1: Send an empty array to remove all social networks
notes.2: Supported platforms: Instagram, Twitter/X, LinkedIn, Facebook, Telegram, etc.

get-active-devices.title: Get Active Devices
get-active-devices.description: Retrieve a paginated list of all active devices/sessions for the current user.

get-authorization-history.title: Get Authorization History
get-authorization-history.description: Retrieve a paginated list of all login attempts and session history.

notes.0: History includes both active and expired sessions
notes.1: Entries are sorted by log_time descending (newest first)
notes.2: is_active=false indicates expired or terminated sessions

get-device-detail.title: Get Device Detail
get-device-detail.description: Retrieve detailed information about a specific device/session.

change-token-expiration.title: Change Token Expiration
change-token-expiration.description: Change the expiration time for a specific device/session token.

notes.0: Use 7 days as minimum to effectively terminate a session
notes.1: Users can only modify their own device sessions
notes.2: The current device token cannot be terminated

terminate-device-session.title: Terminate Device Session
terminate-device-session.description: Immediately terminate a specific device session by deactivating its token. This logs the user out from that device.

notes.0: This immediately invalidates the device session
notes.1: The logged out device will need to authenticate again
notes.2: Cannot terminate the current device session (the one making the request)
notes.3: Use GET method on same endpoint to retrieve token details instead
